item.title: Asia is ahead of the curve of using AI to fight fraud. Here’s what the rest of the world can learn from it
item.description: As Asia’s crime syndicates make headlines, Asian banks are quietly leading a shift in how to prevent fraud.

item.title: US trading partners ‘dazed and confused’ after tariff court loss
item.description: The judges suggested that any injunction could potentially be narrowed to apply only to those who sued.

item.title: Rudy Giuliani suffers fractured vertebra in car crash after being ‘flagged down’ by domestic violence victim
item.description: His vehicle was hit shortly after pulling onto the highway in a crash that was “entirely unrelated” to the domestic violence incident, Giuliani’s head...

item.title: The Fed’s independence is hanging by a thread, and this ‘nuclear’ scenario would signal ‘things are truly going off the rails,’ economists say
item.description: “The particular case of Governor Cook is not as important as what this latest move shows about the escalation in the assaults on the Fed.”

item.title: Colleges should go ‘medieval’ on students to beat AI cheating, NYU official says
item.description: "Now that most mental effort tied to writing is optional, we need new ways to require the work necessary for learning."
